question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
The $24^\text{th}$ day of a particular month is a Saturday. On what day of the week was the first day of that month?
inference:
The $24^{\text{th}}$ of the month is a Saturday.
The days of the week repeat every 7 days.
So, the $24^{\text{th}}$ is a Saturday.
$24 = 7 \times 3 + 3$.
The $24^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $21^{\text{st}}$, which is a Wednesday.
The $21^{\text{st}}$ is 3 days after the $18^{\text{th}}$.
The $18^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $14^{\text{th}}$.
The $14^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $7^{\text{th}}$.
The $7^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $1^{\text{st}}$.
Since the $24^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after Wednesday, the $1^{\text{st}}$ is 3 days before Wednesday.
Counting back 3 days from Wednesday, we have Tuesday, Monday, Sunday.
So, the $1^{\text{st}}$ of the month is a Sunday.
Final Answer: $\boxed{Sunday}$
ground_truth: If the $24$th is a Saturday, the $17$th was also a Saturday, as were the $10$th and the $3$rd.  So the $2$nd was a Friday and the $1$st was a $\boxed{\text{Thursday}}$.

question:
The $24^{\text{th}}$ of the month is a Saturday.
The days of the week repeat every 7 days.
So, the $24^{\text{th}}$ is a Saturday.
$24 = 7 \times 3 + 3$.
The $24^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $21^{\text{st}}$, which is a Wednesday.
The $21^{\text{st}}$ is 3 days after the $18^{\text{th}}$.
The $18^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $14^{\text{th}}$.
The $14^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $7^{\text{th}}$.
The $7^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $1^{\text{st}}$.
Since the $24^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after Wednesday, the $1^{\text{st}}$ is 3 days before Wednesday.
Counting back 3 days from Wednesday, we have Tuesday, Monday, Sunday.
So, the $1^{\text{st}}$ of the month is a Sunday.
Final Answer: $\boxed{Sunday}$

inference:
The $24^{\text{th}}$ of the month is a Saturday.
The days of the week repeat every 7 days.
The $24^{\text{th}}$ of the month is 3 days after the $21^{\text{st}}$ of the month, which is 3 days after a Wednesday.
The $21^{\text{st}}$ is 3 days after the $18^{\text{th}}$.
The $18^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $14^{\text{th}}$.
The $14^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $7^{\text{th}}$.
The $7^{\text{th}}$ is 3 days after the $1^{\text{st}}$.
Since the $24^{\text{th}}$ is a Saturday, the $21^{\text{st}}$ is a Wednesday.
Counting back 3 days from Wednesday, we have Tuesday, Monday, Sunday.
The $1^{\text{st}}$ of the month is a Sunday.

Final Answer: $\boxed{Sunday}$
ground_truth: If the $24$th is a Saturday, the $17$th was also a Saturday, as were the $10$th and the $3$rd.  So the $2$nd was a Friday and the $1$st was a $\boxed{\text{Thursday}}$.
